result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric W Kretlow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: $1,886.25 in restitution to be paid (Jointly and Severally liable) as a condition of probation.  Defendant can do Community Service with a non-profit organization at $10.00 a hour when verified by Agent. Agent to adjust assessment if completed.
Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.

Attend a criminal thinking course.  No contact with co-defendant.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Eric W Kretlow
Current: N4934 County Rd N, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 01-12-2016)
Prior: S85 W18606 Jean Dr., Muskego, WI 53150 United States

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC 11/10/15
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Eric W Kretlow in court with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.  Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 3 and Count 4.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
Count 3:
- 6 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED Consecutive to any other sentences. 
- 18 months Probation. 
- $1,886.25 in restitution to be paid(Jointly and Severally liable) as a condition of Probation. Defendant can do Community service with a non-profit organization at $10.00 a hour when verified by Agent. 
- Court costs WAIVED
- DNA Surcharge WAIVED
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No contact with co-defendant.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.  Attend a criminal thinking course. 

CONDITION TIME: 90 Days WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED to be used at Agents discretion. 

Count 4:
- 6 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED Consecutive to Count 3 and any other sentences. 
- 18 months Probation.  
- Court costs WAIVED
- DNA Surcharge WAIVED
- Conditions of Probation:  same as Count 3
